name: Durham Marriott City Center

reviews.text: The hotel was very nice inside, staff was friendly, and the room was clean. I was lucky enough to get a corner room on the 4th floor with 2 walls of windows, but unfortunately, Raleigh is not much to look at. (I literally had a clear view of the Lucky Strike factory smoke stack. Yipee!)
reviews.title: Hotel was great for business trip!

likes.liked: — Great business center- free computer and printer use! (RARE!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was there on business, hosted a meeting in one of their ballrooms and I must say, I would highly recommend them for this service. The staff really makes a difference and did everything possible to make us comfortable and feel appreciated. The hotel restaurant by the bar has great burgers but service is a bit slow. Pricey too, but its to be expected from an in-house restaurant.
reviews.title: very nice hotel in Durham

likes.liked: — location close to a show we were seeing

reviews.title: Great Stay!!
reviews.text: Overall, it was an excellent hotel- though they did forget my 4:45am wake up call and I almost missed my car to the airport. (GRRR!) So set your own alarms and you should have a great stay.

Beautiful hotel with first class service. Friendly employees. Perfectly clean room with the MOST comfortable beds we have ever slept on. Room service breakfast was good, but the hotel restaurantt was way overpriced for what they served. Only negative was the NO SMOKING policy. Everybody in the lounge wanted to smoke-yet you had to take a long walk outside to do so. and no smoking in the rooms.
reviews.title: Interesting City, Great Hotel

reviews.text: I traveled to Durham for a medical appointment and stumbled upon this great hotel through Tripadvisor. I was VERY pleased with this place and WILL stay again sometime in the near future.
reviews.title: Great service, nice rooms for our conference

likes.liked: — Elegant and up-to-date rooms and conference facilities, free parking and internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here twice in the past couple years and this Marriott has always been very accommodating between the Platinum upgrades to the impeccable service. We will always stay here when we are in Durham.
reviews.title: Always Accommodating

reviews.text: This hotel is within walking distance of many fine Farm to Table restaurants. The ice cream parlor and bakery were closed on the days we visited. I will seek them out on my next visit.
reviews.title: The only hotel in the City Center area and a few b&bs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 20 minutes by car or 2 buses to/from the Airport. The complimentary Bull City Connector bus is less than 2 blocks away. You may take a ride to Duke University and walk around the campus.
reviews.title: Nice hotel
Service could not be any better!

reviews.text: The 2 light fixtures located on the desk and side tables had an abundance of AC outlets for electronics
reviews.title: Nice place to stay in the heart of Durham NC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a good experience at this property. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable and we had a very nice view of the whole area from our window.
reviews.title: Nice property

likes.disliked: — The construction in the immediate area caused some inconvenience, however we believe it's a good sign of investment by the local government.

reviews.title: Hotel was Great, Service Etc.. but Durham Looks lIke a War Zone...
reviews.text: The thing that makes this property stand out is the staff. The morale is obviously good - every staff member we spoke with - from the bell person, to the valet parking person, the front desk staff, housekeeping and the bartender - were friendly, very helpful and competent.

reviews.title: Hopeful Duke Mom :) says this place was great!
reviews.text: The area is undergoing a lot of construction and improvements, which is a good sign that they are investing money in that area. We ate at a very nice - and very new - restaurant called Rue Clair. It was right down the street and we had an excellent dinner (with excellent service). This town has a lot of potential, and we're looking forward to going back at some point to see what progress they are making.

reviews.title: Large Rooms - Friendly Service
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night at the end of July. The hotel was very nice. The rooms were clean, and the hotel staff was very pleasant.

description: Welcome to the Durham Marriott City Center. Situated downtown, you’ll love how the hotel and the city seamlessly blend the modern and the historic. The Durham Marriott Convention Center is connected to the 44,000 square foot Durham Convention Center and adjacent to the beautifully restored Carolina Theatre. Minutes away from Duke University, Duke Hospitals, and North Carolina Central University, this modern hotel compliments the heritage and classic architecture found throughout the city. Designed for both the business traveler and family vacationer, our comfortable accommodations and outstanding Marriott service ensure a memorable and productive visit. The Durham Marriott City Center is known for its helpful and knowledgeable staff that will ensure you get the most from your stay. Rooms at the hotel include Marriot’s luxurious revived bedding package accompanied by high-definition flat screen televisions. Guests on the concierge level enjoy the added benefit of the concierge lounge serving appetizers and snacks throughout the day. All guests appreciate the state of the art fitness center highlighted by eight units with 17 inch TV screens. Dining options include the 2 zero 1 restaurant with continental American dining and a casual atmosphere. The 2 zero 1 lounge offers nightly specials and a relaxed setting. So what are you waiting for? Book your room today!
